text:
Host: Linux video 3.2.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.2.46-1 x86_64 GNU/Linux
apache2 : V 2.2.2 (installed from Debian repository)

When an file in the http doc tree is named like "image01.mp4.png" or "image01.mp4.jpg" is clicked on any browser, the web server reports 

"Unsupported Media Type
The supplied request data is not in a format acceptable for processing by this resource.
Apache/2.2.22 (Debian) Server at 139.179.39.104 Port 80

If the image file is renamed to "image01.png" or "image01.jpg", the problem disappears.

If the filename ends with *.mp4_jpg", there is no problem.

I tried to add the mime-type ".mp4.jpg" to apache's mime.conf file and restarted apache2, but the problem was still there.

The bug is demonstrated here: http://139.179.39.104/bug/
creator: cayfer@bilkent.edu.tr
cayfer@bilkent.edu.tr
text:
apparently apache has the concept of "multiple extensions" for files.
order of handdler and mime-type  interpretation waws the issu
